inclusion.criterion: Presence of symptoms of an ischemic stroke with a baseline National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) scale of one up to 20 or due to an ipsilateral atherosclerotic >50% stenosis of the extracranial internal carotid artery (ICA) as shown by ultrasonography.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Latency between the onset of stroke symptoms and intended administration of the study drugs is not more than 24 hours.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Latency between the intended administration of the study drugs and intended carotid endarterectomy is at least three days.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Documented peptic ulcer disease within the preceding 30 days.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe illness (active cancer or significant liver or renal disease) or disability.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Need for chronic anticoagulant therapy (e.g. atrial fibrillation, deep venous thrombosis).
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Need for long-term daily nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Contraindications for platelet therapy such as severe bleeding disorder within the past three months prior to randomization (coagulopathy, platelet disorder including history of heparin-induced thrombopenia, hemorrhage) or significant retinopathy with hemorrhages and exudates.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hypersensitivity to abciximab, murine monoclonal antibodies or aspirin.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any preexisting intracranial neurological disease such as tumor or multiple sclerosis.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Intracranial or intraspinal operation or trauma or lumbar puncture within the last 2 months.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Cardiac lesions likely to cause cardioembolism.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of CAD s/p CABG, EF 60% prior CVA (no residual deficits), HTN, HL, DMII, Moderate to Severe PVD. He reports occasional dizziness and no prior syncope or sensory/motor defects.
